alert.note: Alert for Benton (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 06 at 12:47PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Oregon, including the following counties, Benton, Clackamas, Columbia, Lane, Lincoln, Linn, Marion, Multnomah, Polk, Tillamook, Washington and Yamhill and southwest Washington, including the following counties, Clark, Cowlitz and Wahkiakum. * WHEN...Until 100 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is possible through this afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1241 PM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated areas of moderate to heavy rain. This is causing flooding of creeks and some roads. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 8 inches of rain have fallen in the past 48 hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 2 inches are expected over the area through this evening. This additional rain could increase flooding for some areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
